title: REST API Version 2
description:
Circuit REST API to interact with the Circuit system.

[Learn more about the Circuit Development Community](https://www.circuit.com/web/developers/home)

fields.redirect_uri: The callback URL for your application

scopes.ALL: allows full access to all functionalities of the REST API
scopes.CALLS: allows to start or join real time collaboration session
scopes.READ_CONVERSATIONS: allows to read conversations of the authenticated user
scopes.READ_USER: allows to read user information for all users that belong to the tenant of the authenticated user
scopes.READ_USER_PROFILE: allows to read the user profile of the authenticated user
scopes.WRITE_CONVERSATIONS: allows to create and update conversations of the authenticated user or to post messages
scopes.WRITE_USER_PROFILE: allows to update the user profile of the authenticated user

bridgeNumber.description: The number that has to be called to join the real time session of a conversation

country.description: The country where the bridge is hosted

name.description: The name / identifier of the bridge

type.description: Information of the billing for the call, i.e. if the caller has to pay or not for the call

avatar.description: The URL of the small avatar image of the conversation

avatarLarge.description: The URL of the large avatar image of the conversation

convId.description: The ID of the conversation

creationTime.description: UTC timestamp when the conversation was created

creatorId.description: The ID of the user who created the conversation

creatorTenantId.description: The ID of the Circuit domain (tenant) where the creator of the conversation belongs to

description.description: The description of the conversation. This field is available only for conversations with type COMMUNITY

isGuestAccessDisabled.description: Indicates whether guest access to the conversation is disabled or not

isModerated.description: Indicates whether the conversation is moderated or not. In a moderated conversation only participants who have been assigned the role of a moderator are allowed to add or remove participants into the conversation

modificationTime.description: UTC timestamp when the conversation was modified. A conversation is modified when any of the conversation object fields change but not when conversation items are added or edited

topic.description: The title of the conversation. Conversations of type DIRECT cannot have a title

type.description: The type of the conversation. It can be one of the following: DIRECT, GROUP, COMMUNITY or LARGE

bridgeNumbers.description: A list of bridge numbers which can be used to dial in to the real time session via phone

conversationCreatorId.description: The user ID of the conversation creator

isModerationAllowed.description: Indicates if the conversation is allowed to be moderated

isRecordingAllowed.description: Indicates if the conversation is allowed to be recorded

link.description: A link that can be used in a browser to join the session

pin.description: The PIN to join a real time session via phone

attachments.description: Array of files attached to the item

convId.description: The ID of the conversation the item belongs to

creationTime.description: UTC timestamp when the item was created

creatorId.description: The ID of the user who created the conversation item

includeInUnreadCount.description: Indicates whether the item is included in the unread message count

modificationTime.description: UTC timestamp when the conversation was modified

type.description: The type of the conversation item. It can be one of the following TEXT, SYSTEM or RTC

matchingConversations.description: A list of result items for conversations that match the search term.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the matching items belong.

itemIds.description: The conversation items which contain the search result. The list maybe empty in case a hit was found for the conversation related data like topic or participants.

content.description: The content of the text item

contentType.description: The type of the text item. It can be one of the following: RICH (with HTML content) or PLAIN (only text)

likedUserIds.description: Array of IDs of the users who liked the item

parentId.description: The ID of the parent item of the text item. This field is optional and can be used for thread views

state.description: The state of the text item. It can be one of the following: CREATED (which denotes that it was not modified since its creation), EDITED (which denotes that the creator of this item modified the item) or DELETED (which denotes that the item itself exists but its content was removed)

subject.description: TThe subject of the text item. This field is optional and maybe filled when creating the text item

accessTokenURL.description: The URL to fetch the access token for an authorization code

applicationName.description: A free text identifier of the application that uses the client ID

authorizationURL.description: The URL to redirect a user for Circuit authentication

domains.description: The valid domains for the client ID

grantTypes.description: A list of grant types which are supported by this client ID

scopes.description: The available scopes for OAUTH 2.0 access

ttl.description: The TTL for a token generated with this client ID

userId.description: The ID of the user who owns a token

dndUntil.description: Timestamp until the DND state of the user is active

isOptedOut.description: Indicates whether the user has opted out of their presence

latitude.description: The latitude of the geo location of the user

locationText.description: The geo location of the user in clear text

longitude.description: The longitude of the geo location of the user

mobile.description: Identifies whether the presence state is based on the state information of a mobile device or not

state.description: The presence state of the user. It can be one of the following: AVAILABLE, OFFLINE, AWAY, BUSY, or DND (Do-Not-Disturb)

statusMessage.description: A free formed status message of the user

timeZoneOffset.description: The timezone offset of the user compared to UTC

type.description: The type of the RTC item
The type of the system item

company.description: The name of the user's company

emailAddress.description: The primary email address of the user

firstName.description: The first name of the user

jobTitle.description: The job title of the user

lastName.description: The last name of the user

locale.description: The locale of the user. (E.g. en-US, de-DE)

accessToken.description: The access token issued by the authorization server

clientId.description: The client ID used to generate the access token

expirationTime.description: The date when the token expires

scopes.description: Array of the scopes of the access token

actions.title: getConversations
actions.description: Gets a list of conversations and communities the authenticated user participates in.

modTime.description: The modification time of the conversation in UTC format. During the query the conversations before (default) or after this timestamp are returned. In case no timestamp is specified the current server time in UTC is used, i.e. the last 25 modified conversations are returned

direction.description: The direction of the search based on the modification time. Valid values are either BEFORE (default) or AFTER

results.description: The maximum number of returned results (default 25). The maximum allowed value is 100.

actions.title: getCommunityConversations
actions.description: Gets a list of communities. This endpoint can be used to explore the communities the authenticated user could join.

sort.description: Defines the type of sorting for the community conversations (default is alphabetical)

order.description: Defines the ordering of the conversations (default is ascending)

includeOwn.description: If set to false only conversations are returned where the user is no member of, otherwise all community conversations are returned

startIndex.description: The index of the conversation that is the first one that has to be returned. E.g. if a request starts with startIndex 40 and results 20 the conversations 40 to 60 are returned

results.description: The maximum number of returned results (default 25). The maximum allowed value is 100.

actions.title: createCommunityConversation
actions.description: Creates a community. Communities are open conversations that anyone in a Circuit domain (tenant) can join without having to be added by another user.

participants.description: list of participants that will be part of this conversation, specified by the Circuit user ID or the unique email address. At least one participant needs to be added

description.description: An optional description for the community conversation

topic.description: An optional topic of the conversation. If not set the Circuit client will render the names of the participants as topic of the conversation (the first 4 names will be used)

actions.title: updateConversationCommunity
actions.description: Updates the information of the given community.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation which should be updated

description.description: An optional description for the community conversation

topic.description: An optional topic of the conversation. If not set the Circuit client will render the names of the participants as topic of the conversation (the first 4 names will be used)

actions.title: joinCommunityConversation
actions.description: Adds the authenticated user to the given community (i.e., allows the user to join this community). Contrary to the operation of adding a new participant, this operation can only be performed by a user who is not yet a member of the community.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation which the user will join

actions.title: removeParticipantCommunity
actions.description: Removes one or more participants from the given community. The last participant of a community cannot be removed. This operation can only be performed by a user who is already a member of the community.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation from which the participant have to be removed

participants.description: The IDs or the unique email addresses of the Circuit users that have to be removed

actions.title: addParticipantCommunity
actions.description: Adds one or more participants to the given community. This operation can only be performed by a user who is already a member of the community.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the participant has to be added.

participants.description: The IDs or the unique email addresses of the Circuit users that should to be added.

actions.title: createDirectConversation
actions.description: Creates a 1-to-1 conversation between the authenticated user and the user with the provided userId. In case there is already an existing 1-to-1 conversation between these users, the endpoint returns the existing conversation.

participant.description: The participant that will be part of this conversation together with the creator, specified by the Circuit user ID or the unique email address

actions.title: getFavoriteConversations
actions.description: Gets the conversationIds which are marked as favorites.

actions.title: createGroupConversation
actions.description: Creates a group conversation between three or more users. The authenticated user is directly added to this conversation.

participants.description: A list of participants that will be part of this conversation, specified by the Circuit user ID or the unique email address. At least one participant needs to be added

topic.description: An optional topic of the conversation. If not set the Circuit client will render the names of the participants as topic of the conversation (the first 4 names will be used)

actions.title: updateConversationGroup
actions.description: Updates the information of the given group conversation.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation which should be updated

topic.description: An optional topic of the conversation. If not set the Circuit client will render the names of the participants as topic of the conversation (the first 4 names will be used)

actions.title: removeParticipantGroup
actions.description: Removes one or more participants from the given group conversation. The last participant of a group conversation cannot be removed. This operation can only be performed on behalf of a user who is already a member of the conversation.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation from which the participant have to be removed

participants.description: The IDs or the unique email addresses of the Circuit users that have to be removed

actions.title: addParticipantGroup
actions.description: Adds one or more participants to the given group conversation. This operation can only be performed by a user who is already a member of the conversation.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the participant has to be added.

participants.description: The IDs or the unique email addresses of the Circuit users that should to be added.

actions.title: getFlagItemConv
actions.description: Gets a list of all the messages the authenticated user has flagged. This endpoint should be used carefully in case where the authenticated user has a lot of flagged messages.

actions.title: searchConversations
actions.description: Performs a search for conversation content. A maximum of 100 conversations is returned. If you hit this limit you should refine the search term.

actions.title: getConversationbyId
actions.description: Gets a conversation based on the given ID.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation which should be updated

actions.title: getJoinDetails
actions.description: Gets the conference details of the given conversation. Conference details include the URL, which is used to join the conference through a web or mobile application, as well as the dial-in phone numbers and conference PIN, which are used to join the conference by phone.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation for which the join details should be returned

actions.title: deleteFavorite
actions.description: Removes a conversation from favorites. Favorites can be displayed in a separate side tab inside of the Circuit client to have a better overview of important conversations.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation which will be unmarked as favorite

actions.title: addFavorite
actions.description: Adds a conversation to the favorites. Favorites can be displayed in a separate side tab inside of the Circuit client to have a better overview of important conversations.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation which will be marked as favorite

actions.title: getConversationItems
actions.description: Gets a list of conversation items.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the items belong

modTime.description: The modification time of the item in UTC format. During the query the items before (default) or after this timestamps are returned. In case no timestamp is specified the current server time in UTC is used, i.e. the last 25 modified items are returned

direction.description: The direction of the search based on the modification time. Valid values are either BEFORE (default) or AFTER

results.description: The maximum number of returned results (default 25). The maximum allowed value is 100.

actions.title: assignLabel
actions.description: Adds a label to a conversation, you can search and organize your conversations based on these labels

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the label is added

actions.title: unassignLabel
actions.description: Removes a label from a conversation, you can search and organize your conversations based on these labels

convId.description: The ID of the conversation from which the label is removed

actions.title: addTextItem
actions.description: Adds a message to the given conversation. This operation can be only performed on behalf of a user who is already a member of the conversation.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the new item has to be added

content.description: The actual content of the item, is mandatory unless an attachment is added

attachments.description: A comma separated list of attachment IDs from the file API.

subject.description: The subject (headline) of the new text item

actions.title: getFlagItem
actions.description: Gets a list of all the flagged messages in the given conversation.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the item belongs

actions.title: deleteTextItem
actions.description: Marks a message in the given conversation as deleted. Deleted messages are still part of the conversation, but their content is no more visible. This operation can only be performed on behalf of the message's creator.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the item belongs

itemId.description: The ID of the item that will be deleted

actions.title: addTextItemWithParent
actions.description: Adds a message to the existing item. The added message will be a child item of the message with the given itemId.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the new item has to be added

itemId.description: The ID of the item to which the new one has to be added as child

content.description: The actual content of the item

subject.description: The subject (headline) of the new text item

actions.title: updateTextItem
actions.description: Updates the content or subject of the existing message. Only the creator of the message is allowed to perform this operation.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the item belongs

itemId.description: The ID of the item to update

content.description: The actual content of the item

subject.description: The subject (headline) of the new text item

actions.title: unFlagItem
actions.description: Removes the flag from a given message that is posted to the given conversation.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the item belongs

itemId.description: The ID of the item that will be flagged

actions.title: flagItem
actions.description: Adds a flag to the given message in the given conversation.

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the item belongs

itemId.description: The ID of the item that will be flagged

itemCreationTime.description: The time when the item was created

parentId.description: The ID of the item's parent

actions.title: unlikeItem
actions.description: Removes a "like" from the given message in the given conversation

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the item belongs

itemId.description: The ID of the item that will be unliked

actions.title: likeItem
actions.description: Adds a "like" to the given message in the given conversation

convId.description: The ID of the conversation to which the item belongs

itemId.description: The ID of the item that will be liked

actions.title: oAuthGetClientIds
actions.description: Gets a list of the client IDs (applications) that were created for this user.

actions.title: oAuthValidateAccessToken
actions.description: Gets the access token for the given token ID.

tokenId.description: The unique id of the token to get the data for.

actions.title: searchUser
actions.description: Gets a user based on an email address or username. If both parameters are defined, the email address will be used.

name.description: Search for a user by name

actions.title: getLabel
actions.description: Returns all labels of the user that were defined either explicit or implicit via assignment to conversations.

actions.title: addLabel
actions.description: Add a label to the list of user labels

actions.title: removeLabel
actions.description: Remove a label from the list of user labels

actions.title: getPresence
actions.description: Gets the presence status of the users whose IDs or email addresses are given.

userIds.description: A list of unique user IDs or email addresses of the users you want to query the presence state for

actions.title: setUserPresence
actions.description: Updates the presence status of the authenticated user.

dndUntil.description: Timestamp until the DND state of the user is active. This field is mandatory when the state is set to DND.

statusMessage.description: An optional status message that is displayed instead of the location

actions.title: getProfile
actions.description: Gets the authenticated user's profile information.

actions.title: updateProfile
actions.description: Updates the user profile of the authenticated user

firstname.description: The new firstname of the user

lastname.description: The new lastname of the user

jobTitle.description: The new job title of the user

locale.description: The new locale of the user. One of EN_US, DE_DE, EN_GB, ES_ES, FR_FR, IT_IT, RU_RU, ZH_HANS_CN.

actions.title: getUserById
actions.description: Gets the profile information of the user with the given ID.

id.description: The unique ID or the email address of the user to fetch

actions.title: getUserPresence
actions.description: Gets the presence status of the users whose ID or email address is given.

id.description: The unique ID or the email address of the user to fetch.
